001package calibration_demos;
002
003import ij.IJ;
004import ij.ImagePlus;
005import ij.io.LogStream;
006import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
007import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.testdata.ZhangData;
008import imagingbook.lib.util.ResourceUtils;
009
010/**
011 * Opens Zhang's standard calibration images as a stack of RGB images. 
012 * The image data are stored as a resource in the local Java class tree.
013 * This plugin also demonstrates the use of the resource access
014 * mechanism.
015 * 
016 * @author W. Burger
017 * @version 2017-05-30
018 *
019 */
020public class Open_Test_Images implements PlugIn {
021        
022        static {
023                LogStream.redirectSystem();
024        }
025        
026        static Class<?> resourceRootClass = ZhangData.class;
027        static String resourceDir = "resources/";
028        static String resourceName = "CalibImageStack.tif";
029
030        public void run(String arg0) {
031                if(ResourceUtils.isInsideJar(resourceRootClass))
032                        IJ.log("Loading resource from JAR file");
033                else
034                        IJ.log("Loading resource from file system");
035                
036                ImagePlus im = ResourceUtils.openImageFromResource(resourceRootClass, resourceDir, resourceName);
037                
038                if (im != null) {
039                        im.show();
040                }
041                else {
042                        IJ.error("Could not load resource!");
043                }
044        }
045        
046}
